titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Yvar Mikhashoff Photograph Collection, circa 1930-1993
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Photograph Collection, circa 1930-1993
did.langmaterial: No textual materials included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 423 indexed images and approximately 350 additional, un-indexed snapshots. The images include publicity shots, professional photographs and snapshots of Mikhashoff in rehearsal and performance, and snapshots from some of Mikhashoff's travels. Other people included in the images include noteworthy performers and composers, such as Aaron Copland, Virgil Thomson, Sylvano Bussotti, Henri Dutilleux, Giacinto Scelsi, Toru Takemitsu, Frederic Rzewski, Luis de Pablo, Henry Brant, John Cage, Milton Babbitt, Conlon Nancarrow, Nils Vigeland, and Poul Ruders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Yvar Mikhashoff Photograph Collection, circa 1930-1993, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the estate of Yvar Mikhashoff, 1993

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: Collection has been digitized and is available in UB LIbraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Yvar-Emilian Mikhashoff was born Ronald McKay in Troy near Albany, New York in 1941. He began piano studies with Betty Weir and Stanley Hummel in Albany. At the Eastman School of Music in 1959, he first took a major in composition and cello, then changed to piano studies with Armand Basile. In the 1961 academic year, he studied piano at the Juilliard School in New York City. He also had a career as a ballroom dancer from 1962-1965.

In 1964 Mikhashoff entered the University of Houston for studies in piano with Albert Hirsh. He earned a B.M. in 1967 and continued with graduate study in composition with Elmer Schoettle and obtained his M.M in 1968. It was during this period that McKay adopted his grandfather's name, Mikhashoff.

Receiving a Fulbright scholarship, he studied the music of the French Impressionists with Nadia Boulanger. After his return to the United States, McKay entered the University of Texas at Austin as a doctoral candidate in composition and studied with Hunter Johnson, Kent Kennan, Janet McGaughey and Karl Korte. He earned a Doctor of Musical Arts degree with a major in composition and a minor in literature in August 1973 and founded the Cambiata Soloists ensemble. In the Fall of 1973 Mikhashoff was appointed Assistant Professor at the State University of New York at Buffalo. Based in Buffalo until his death in 1993 , Mikhashoff had an international performing career which led him to promote new music and American music around the world.

In addition to organizing many festivals and broadcasts of new music throughout the world, Mikhashoff was one of the founders of the North American New Music Festival and its director for 11 years. He commissioned works from such notable composers as John Cage, Lukas Foss, Otto Luening, Poul Ruders, James Sellars, Christian Wolff, and many others; he edited some works of Henry Cowell, Lejaren Hiller, Conlon Nancarrow, and Virgil Thomson. He recorded on the New Albion, Mode, RCA Victor, CRI, and Spectrum record labels. Yvar Mikhashoff's support of contemporary music continues today through the Yvar Mikhashoff Trust for New Music which was created by his estate to support composers and performers of new music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Yvar Mikhashoff Photograph Collection contains 423 indexed images that chiefly document the professional life of pianist and composer Yvar Mikhashoff. The collection includes photographs by professional photographers such as Sarah Ainslie, Irene Haupt, Joann Miles, Annette Faltin, Lelli & Masotti, Wim Riemens, Gerda van der Veen, and Keith Gemerek. These photographs include publicity shots and images of Mikhashoff in performance or rehearsal. The snapshots in the collection provide a more casual look at Mikhashoff during his travels, performances, and with friends.

The list of composers included in the collection is indicative of Mikhashoff's involvement in contemporary music in America and internationally. The composers include Aaron Copland, Virgil Thomson, Sylvano Bussotti, Henri Dutilleux, Giacinto Scelsi, Toru Takemitsu, Frederic Rzewski, Luis de Pablo, Henry Brant, John Cage, Milton Babbitt, Conlon Nancarrow, Nils Vigeland, and Poul Ruders.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in four series:

list.item: I. Photographs (133) and drawings (5) of Yvar Mikhashoff alone. Arranged in rough chronological order.

II. Photographs (285) of Yvar Mikhashoff with other people, other people without Mikhashoff, Mikhashoff alone when part of a photographic sequence, and scenes from Mikhashoff's travels. Arranged in rough chronological order.

IV. Approximately 350 snapshots with and without negatives, in 42 photo envelopes. Photographs of Yvar Mikhashoff were removed from this portion of the collection to be part of the indexed collection, Containers 1-4. Most of the remaining photographs are of landscapes and scenes encountered during Mikhashoff's travels to Czechoslovokia , Egypt , Israel, Jordan, and Mexico. Not indexed.

physdesc.extent: Container 6: approximately 350 snapshots, with and without negatives, in 42 photo envelopes.

scopecontent.p: Most of the remaining photographs are of landscapes and scenes encountered during Mikhashoff's travels to Czechoslovokia , Egypt , Israel, Jordan , and Mexico.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.item:
The Yvar Mikhashoff Archive consists of the following separate components:
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Compositions
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Transcriptions
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Annotated Scores
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Tangos
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Sound Recordings
Yvar Mikhashoff Cassette Collection
Yvar Mikhashoff Video Collection
Yvar Mikhashoff Slide Collection
